content.raw: The former `Virtual STIX` might not have the origin updated like the practice and simple worlds.  Therefore, I suggest to test with those instead of with the `Virtual STIX` .
content.html: The former Virtual STIX might not have the origin updated like the practice and simple worlds. Therefore, I suggest to test with those instead of with the Virtual STIX .

content.raw: Well, it is pity :disappointed: … if it would not be 1 day to final submission I would ask you to fix this world. BTW it would be nice \(next time\) to have on AWS also the original qualification world \(maybe with swapped types of artifacts, as they changed in meantime\), so that we can test larger environments “we are used to”.
content.html: Well, it is pity … if it would not be 1 day to final submission I would ask you to fix this world. BTW it would be nice (next time) to have on AWS also the original qualification world (maybe with swapped types of artifacts, as they changed in meantime), so that we can test larger environments “we are used to”.

content.raw: The `Virtual STIX` origin has not been updated to coincide with the revised origin in the tile set worlds.  The `Virtual STIX` world is better preparation and testing for a systems-track experiment or general robustness experiment for a virtual submission solution.  There are a number of differences you will encounter in the `Virtual STIX` environment that are not present in the virtual challenge tile set.  The terrain ruggedness in the `Virtual STIX` can impact your robot’s control and state estimation differently than the tile set worlds.  Also, communication is not modeled in the `Virtual STIX` environment \(to my knowledge\).
content.html: The Virtual STIX origin has not been updated to coincide with the revised origin in the tile set worlds. The Virtual STIX world is better preparation and testing for a systems-track experiment or general robustness experiment for a virtual submission solution. There are a number of differences you will encounter in the Virtual STIX environment that are not present in the virtual challenge tile set. The terrain ruggedness in the Virtual STIX can impact your robot’s control and state estimation differently than the tile set worlds. Also, communication is not modeled in the Virtual STIX environment (to my knowledge).

content.raw: OK. Thank you Arthur for explanation and detail info. The leader board is then a bit misleading, probably?? Low priority.
content.html: OK. Thank you Arthur for explanation and detail info. The leader board is then a bit misleading, probably?? Low priority.

content.raw:
I believe leader boards were automatically generated for all environments available for competitors to submit against.

‌

Strictly speaking, the leader board for environments that competitors have access to should be considered for-fun given that you can locally access those environments and it is possible to hard-code a scenario in to achieve a score much higher than your autonomy is capable of achieving in an unknown environment.
content.html:
I believe leader boards were automatically generated for all environments available for competitors to submit against.

‌

Strictly speaking, the leader board for environments that competitors have access to should be considered for-fun given that you can locally access those environments and it is possible to hard-code a scenario in to achieve a score much higher than your autonomy is capable of achieving in an unknown environment.

content.raw:
It used to be fun a year ago, now it is just nightmare :wink: … so if you are aware that some worlds do not work I would remove them, so that competitors do not waste any of the remaining time with it. I used “Virtual STIX” as example of “unknown tunnel”, tried couple times to deploy docker and when it finally passed I found out that the world is not shifted … but maybe you understand me.

Regarding hard-code scenario … yes, you are right, but you do not have to run it locally, and may explore it on AWS only. That is actually the fun part :slight_smile:  …

Maybe one note regarding score \(I am not sure if to create another Issue, probably not now\) would be option to remove your attempt from fun-table … like our test in Practice Tunnel 01, when we tested if you can report artifacts you did not visit from tunnel entrance.

‌
content.html:
It used to be fun a year ago, now it is just nightmare … so if you are aware that some worlds do not work I would remove them, so that competitors do not waste any of the remaining time with it. I used “Virtual STIX” as example of “unknown tunnel”, tried couple times to deploy docker and when it finally passed I found out that the world is not shifted … but maybe you understand me.

Regarding hard-code scenario … yes, you are right, but you do not have to run it locally, and may explore it on AWS only. That is actually the fun part …

Maybe one note regarding score (I am not sure if to create another Issue, probably not now) would be option to remove your attempt from fun-table … like our test in Practice Tunnel 01, when we tested if you can report artifacts you did not visit from tunnel entrance.

content.raw: Allowing competitors to modify which practice runs are reported on the leader board would be a neat feature.
content.html: Allowing competitors to modify which practice runs are reported on the leader board would be a neat feature.
